snippet: The second-quarter income announcement showed the desktop search business continued to slow, while ad prices fell.
abstract: Google reports second-quarter income showing that its desktop search business continued to slow, while ad prices fell; profit was $3.23 billion, or $9.54 a share, up from $2.79 billion, or $8.42 a share in year-ago quarter; revenue rose 19 percent to $14.11 billion from $11.8 billion.
lead_paragraph: The second-quarter income announcement showed the desktop search business continued to slow, while ad prices fell.

headline.main: Google Results Show Struggle With Mobile
headline.print_headline: Google Results Show Struggle With Mobile
